meanings.definition: A woman who flirts or behaves in a teasing way to attract attention
meanings.sent1: The coquette at the party caught everyone's eye with her playful demeanor.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the coquette of the town for her charming ways.
meanings.sent3: The coquette's antics at the office party kept everyone entertained.
meanings.sent4: Her behavior at the event was like that of a coquette, drawing all eyes towards her.
meanings.sent5: The image of the coquette in the novel was vividly portrayed, captivating the readers.

meanings.definition: To flirt or behave in a teasing way to attract attention
meanings.sent1: She would coquette with the customers to make more sales at the store.
meanings.sent2: He tends to coquette with his classmates to lighten the mood in class.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to coquette with the toy mouse, pouncing on it playfully.
meanings.sent4: The wind coquetted with the leaves, swirling them around in a dance.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes coquetted with mischief as she teased her friend about his crush.
